newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks edge up in special budget session.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks edge up in special budget session.

text.p: Pakistan stocks edged up on Friday at the close of a special trading session arranged to coincide with the fiscal 1997/98 budget and dealers said they expected a small post-budget rally.
The Karachi 100-share index rose 4.46 points, or 0.28 percent, to end at 1,575.88. Gainers beat losers 60 to 29.

"It is good budget in the present circumstances when the country is faced with economic problems," dealer Zaina Nowsherwan said. "A small post-budget rally is due in the near term." PTCL rose 0.50 rupees to 29.55.
